channel.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
channel.description:
Well, I'll be building my own computer soon now that I've run across some money. You guys are pretty smart, so I wanted some feedback on the setup I have. So far the set up should cost around ~$1020 (this is without a monitor) My questions are: 1. How can I improve this build for a reasonable price? 2. Are there any cheap, reliable, high quality monitors (possibly with hdmi support)?
Processor: Core i7-950 3.06GHz Quad core HT support ($230- Great price for this great processor) http://www.microcenter.com/single_product_results.phtml?product_id=0346210
CD/DVD drive: Some decent ASUS worth $20, isn't a big deal to me http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16827135204
Case: Full tower coolermaster, 1,605 reviews and majority 5 eggs, I've seen this in person before and it really is worth the money ($130) http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811119160
Hard Drive: Western Digital 1 TB 7200 RPM ($90) - I'm not too sure what to get as far as hard drives go, I heard this was great for its price http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822136533
Graphics card: Radeon HD 6850 1GB ($180) -- Still not sure what to get; this seemed to be high on the ratings at overclock.net (even though I don't intend to overclock anything) http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814102908
Power supply: OCZ Technology 700W $85 (deal with case too) - Should be enough power http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16817341018
RAM: Corsair XMS3 (2 x 4GB) - Never used a 4GB stick, is it reliable? http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820145315
Motherboard: GIGABYTE GA-X58-USB3 LGA 1366 Intel X58 USB 3.0 ATX - Futureproofin' with 3.0 ($180) http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813128456

item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Mopman:

yeah its all about function, and cheap cases usually dont

Define a functioning case? If it holds the parts who gives a fuck? Unless you want to be a pro and have the best evar air flow… inb4 shit storm…

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Jesus fuck, are people really that worried about cases and trivial shit? Yeah some of them look cool, but like most things in life. Isn’t it all about function? If it fucking works don’t replace it!

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

the bank:

Stop hating on that case. It’s not only the one I chose for my most recent build, it has the best stock cooling of any case I’ve ever used. Those I7s run HOT, same with a lot of nVidia’s higher class video cards, and when ti comes to a case cooling is extremely important for modern day systems, and for a power rig those >$50 cases don’t cut it anymore.

If I ever get around to upgrading my desktop, I’ll let you know how a dented, $35 case handles a modern day system running a hot nvidia card. I’m sure it’ll do fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Stop hating on that case. It’s not only the one I chose for my most recent build, it has the best stock cooling of any case I’ve ever used. Those I7s run HOT, same with a lot of nVidia’s higher class video cards, and when ti comes to a case cooling is extremely important for modern day systems, and for a power rig those >$50 cases don’t cut it anymore.

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Western Digital and Segate are both good. I have 2 in my computer both 500gb and I have 1 in my grandparents build and 1 in my mom and dads build no problem. Mopar, it all comes down to the model. Every brand has its shit models and its great models and nobody is consistent these days. What you want to be looking for are harddrives that have single slates inside because there are usually more reliable due to the fact there is less parts moving around because more information is on one slate.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:14, topic:366047”]The early barracuda 1tb models had multiple faults that caused bricks, so it’s definitely possible that people had trouble with them.

Seagate replaced them if yours was affected, I think.

The new ones don’t have the problem, mine is a champ.[/quote]

I have to check that then. It was a 1 TB one, I just have to find it again. I hope I didn’t throw it away.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @Cbot Cbot
item.description:
@Cbot wrote:

Moparisthebest:

How could that case possibly last longer than any other case? What can go wrong with a case at all? I think I’ve had the same one for many years, and it was free because it was a $35 case that came dented and newegg refunded my money and just let me keep it.

Oh I think you misinterpreted what that meant. I meant the case (out of all the things I would buy for this build) would last the longest, so I might as well make the money count. Sorry.
What can go wrong with the case: Possibly dropping it while moving, dents and stuff. Main point is it’ll last long and the extra money is worth the space inside of the case.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

The early barracuda 1tb models had multiple faults that caused bricks, so it’s definitely possible that people had trouble with them.

Seagate replaced them if yours was affected, I think.

The new ones don’t have the problem, mine is a champ.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:

R.I.P RSC:

The only experience I’ve had with Seagate was a Barracuda, and it died within a year.

I think all of mine are Barracuda’s, I’d have to check though.

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

really, ‘any’ case will do just fine. legitimate concerns are the size, material, layout, whether or not it’s toolless, etc.
it also boils down to what you need and how much you actually care.

for example, this is a fucking amazing case (worth the price). however, if you aren’t the kind of person who is serious about silence/cooling and ease of customization, then you obviously don’t need it.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

How could that case possibly last longer than any other case? What can go wrong with a case at all? I think I’ve had the same one for many years, and it was free because it was a $35 case that came dented and newegg refunded my money and just let me keep it.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @Cbot Cbot
item.description:
@Cbot wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:8, topic:366047”]*Get an i7 950
*Get a Socket 1366 Motherboard: I think this looks good:

newegg.com

GIGABYTE GA-X58A-UD3R LGA 1366 Intel X58 SATA 6Gb/s USB 3.0 ATX Intel...

Buy GIGABYTE GA-X58A-UD3R LGA 1366 Intel X58 SATA 6Gb/s USB 3.0 ATX Intel Motherboard with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!


*Get a $40-50 case or if you feel brave use your current case
*Keep the WD drive. I have 2 and both have survived about 5 years of use.[/quote]
Alright, I’ll follow your advice. Thank you.
I’ll update the 870 to 950 and the motherboard up $70 from the previous one

With the mail in rebates the final price should be around $1020 without the needed monitor/speakers

As for the case, I’m looking to have this computer for a few years, I’ve built a computer (cousin’s) with the case and it runs super quiet/cool. I have enough room and for the extra $80 I’ll get it (since it’ll most likely last longer than anything else in there).

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

*Get an i7 950
*Get a Socket 1366 Motherboard: I think this looks good:

newegg.com

GIGABYTE GA-X58A-UD3R LGA 1366 Intel X58 SATA 6Gb/s USB 3.0 ATX Intel...

Buy GIGABYTE GA-X58A-UD3R LGA 1366 Intel X58 SATA 6Gb/s USB 3.0 ATX Intel Motherboard with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!


*Get a $40-50 case or if you feel brave use your current case
*Keep the WD drive. I have 2 and both have survived about 5 years of use.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:366047”][quote author=Cbot link=topic=462240.msg3381582#msg3381582 date=1288065109]

Don’t go with Western Digital for a hard drive, I’ve had great luck with Seagate drives though. Also, unless you just really HAVE to have THAT case, you can get a good one for $50ish, or less.

I’ve read that Seagate drives die pretty fast, if you could point me out to a well reviewed one 1TB and above I’d so buy it
As for the case, I’ve got enough room and money for it, it’ll be easier for me to work with more room.
[/quote]

All I can tell you is from personal experience, I own at least 6 dead Western Digital drives, and I own 7 or 8 Seagates that I’ve had for years that still work perfectly. I’ve also had good experience with 2 Maxtors, up until 2 years ago when the first Maxtor I bought died, it was 120gb drive that was about 8 years old or so, so that seems acceptable.[/quote]
ive had this wd for almost 4 years now and its just fine!

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Cbot, post:5, topic:366047”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=462240.msg3381462#msg3381462 date=1288057566]
Don’t go with Western Digital for a hard drive, I’ve had great luck with Seagate drives though. Also, unless you just really HAVE to have THAT case, you can get a good one for $50ish, or less.
[/quote]
I’ve read that Seagate drives die pretty fast, if you could point me out to a well reviewed one 1TB and above I’d so buy it
As for the case, I’ve got enough room and money for it, it’ll be easier for me to work with more room.[/quote]

All I can tell you is from personal experience, I own at least 6 dead Western Digital drives, and I own 7 or 8 Seagates that I’ve had for years that still work perfectly. I’ve also had good experience with 2 Maxtors, up until 2 years ago when the first Maxtor I bought died, it was 120gb drive that was about 8 years old or so, so that seems acceptable.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @Cbot Cbot

Don’t go with Western Digital for a hard drive, I’ve had great luck with Seagate drives though. Also, unless you just really HAVE to have THAT case, you can get a good one for $50ish, or less.

As for the case, I’ve got enough room and money for it, it’ll be easier for me to work with more room.

item.title: Need Advice: Possible setup
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Like Moparisthebest said, a cheaper case will probably be better in the end. That HAF is massive, it’s a Full tower, so unless you have plenty of room, and want the 8th wonder of the world on your desk, I’d suggest something smaller.

Read full topic
